column4: i've tried with ms-sys, rescatux, supergrubdisk2, nothing works
sudo software-properties-gtk -e universe && sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install mbr && sudo install-mbr /dev/sda
i only want to fix the mbr that i've lost installing ubuntu. ubuntu caused the problem to windows and not the reverse
I just gave you a solution.
what is the solution? ask in another channel or type the code above?
Type the code that I sent you.
thanks, i will try it now
If that doesn't work, and you only have one hard drive in the computer, then there is something more wrong and you will need to ask in ##windows.
thanks. i hope it will work. supergrubdisk, win7 recovery disk , ms-sys and others didn't...
Have you run the command I gave? Did it finish without any errors?
yes, i've typed the command but nothing happens
only an error for the repos, because i'm running a live ubuntu from a pen drive, not a real cd
Can you please pastebin the exact error message?
OK. The rest of the command should still work despite that error. Please try running "sudo apt-get install mbr && sudo install-mbr /dev/sda" now.
OK. Hopefully if you reboot now you'll be able to access Windows. If not, then something more has gone wrong than what Ubuntu installation and removal of the Ubuntu partition alone will do.
reboot now. i hope it will work
